items.title: Trump's First 100 Days: Impact on the Tech Industry
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Trump’s $10 million settlement with Elon Musk's X (Twitter) from January 6th lawsuit is significant.
- Trump aims to recover $20 billion in funding awarded by Biden’s EPA to curb emissions.
- Federal workers have shifted from platforms like Facebook to encrypted apps like Signal, showing increased distrust.
- NHTSA has censored car crash data reflecting non-binary identities, aligning with previous administration policies.
- The FCC is investigating Comcast's DEI practices under Brendan Carr's mandate.

items.title: The entire story of Twitter / X under Elon Musk
items.author: Verge Staff

items.title: TikTok ban: all the news on the app’s shutdown and return in the US
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- TikTok is back in the App Store after a temporary removal due to a US ban.
- President Trump signed an executive order delaying the enforcement of the TikTok ban for 75 days starting January 20.
- TikTok's service providers face potential penalties for operating the app in the US, despite it being available for download.
- The Supreme Court upheld the TikTok ban law.
- TikTok is now offering a download option for its Android app outside of Google Play due to removal from the platform last month.
- There are discussions around a potential deal involving Oracle and Microsoft to take over TikTok's operations while ByteDance retains a minority stake.

items.title: TikTok is back in the App Store
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- TikTok has been restored in the Apple App Store and Google Play Store.
- The app was banned in the US for nearly a month prior to its return.
- US Attorney General Pam Bondi assured Apple that it wouldn't face fines for hosting the app.
- The removal followed a law banning apps from ByteDance, TikTok's parent company.
- Despite an executive order from President Trump not enforcing the ban for 75 days, Apple and Google initially refrained from hosting the app due to potential penalties.

items.title: Here are the best robot vacuum deals right now
items.author: Quentyn Kennemer
items.summary:
- Robot vacuums are becoming advanced, with models that vacuum and mop, plus self-cleaning features.
- Best deals include **iRobot’s Roomba Combo j7 Plus** for $599, and the **Dreame X40 Ultra** for $999.99.
- **Roomba j7** is currently $299.99, known for AI-powered navigation.
- **iRobot’s Roomba Combo j9 Plus** is priced at $799, featuring self-refilling capabilities.
- The **SwitchBot S10** is available for $612.99, offering a unique self-cleaning mop and bin system.

items.title: Elden Ring: all of the updates about FromSoftware’s open-world hit
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Even Elden Ring’s game director admits that Erdtree difficulty is excessive.
- The DLC, Shadow of the Erdtree, expands the game significantly but carries similar challenges to the base game.
- New content will feature intriguing mysteries that might require a guide.
- Criticism arises regarding the character creator's inclusivity for Black players.
- Overall, Elden Ring is praised as a vast and compelling fantasy experience.

items.title: Gemini AI can now recall past conversations
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Google’s Gemini AI can now recall past conversations for users with a Gemini Advanced subscription through Google One AI Premium.
- The new feature eliminates the need to recap previous chats, allowing Gemini to provide relevant responses based on past discussions.
- Users can also ask Gemini to summarize earlier conversations and manage their chat history at any time.
- The recall feature is available in English on the Gemini web and mobile app, with plans to expand to more languages and Google Workspace customers soon.
- Similar memory features have been implemented in ChatGPT as well.

items.title: Nvidia delays the RTX 5070 till after AMD’s reveal
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- Nvidia delays the launch of RTX 5070 from February to March 5th, 2025.
- The RTX 5070 Ti will be released on February 20th, 2025, ahead of AMD’s Radeon RX 9070 announcement on February 28th, 2025.
- AMD is expected to utilize competitive pricing against Nvidia's offerings, as it has indicated it won't compete at the highest specification level.
- Rumors suggest AMD is developing a more powerful card with 32GB of RAM, although current announcements do not confirm this.

items.title: The best Presidents Day sales you can already shop
items.author: Quentyn Kennemer
items.summary:
- A roundup of the best deals for Presidents Day, including discounts on tech gadgets and home goods.
- Major retailers like [Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/events/presidentsdaysale/?tag=theverge02-20) and [Best Buy](https://howl.link/rq53o3tpgl36i) are currently offering sales.
- Featured deals include Apple devices like the [AirPods Pro](https://www.amazon.com/Apple-Cancellation-Transparency-Personalized-High-Fidelity/dp/B0D1XD1ZV3?tag=theverge02-20) and [Apple Watch Series 10](https://www.amazon.com/Apple-Aluminium-Fitness-Tracker-AppleCare/dp/B0DGJBRKHV?tag=theverge02-20) at competitive prices.
- Additional discounts include Sony’s WH-1000XM5 headphones and Kindle Paperwhite devices.

items.title: Google’s latest Pixel phones are down to some of their best prices
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Last-gen Pixel 8 starting at $399, discounted by $300 at retailers like [Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/Google-Pixel-Unlocked-Smartphone-Advanced/dp/B0CGTNPFZD/?tag=theverge02-20) and [Best Buy](https://howl.link/mqqfoyfunjvdh).
- Pixel 9 starts at $649 with $150 off available at [Google](https://store.google.com/product/pixel_9?hl=en-US), [Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/Google-Pixel-Unlocked-Smartphone-Advanced/dp/B0D7HWJDQM/?th=1&tag=theverge02-20), and [Best Buy](https://howl.link/4fjnqw3q1qarc).
- Pixel 9 Pro and Pixel 9 Pro XL both have $200 off, priced at $799 and $899 respectively.
- Pixel 8 features include seven years of software support, wireless charging, and IP68 rating at a budget price of $399.
- Pixel 9 comes with a 6.3-inch OLED display, Tensor G4 processor, 12GB RAM, and improved dual-camera system.
- Pixel 9 Pro and Pixel 9 Pro XL offer advanced features like 16GB RAM, larger storage options, and fast 8K video recording.

items.title: How to get TikTok back on your phone if you deleted it after the ban
items.author: Barbara Krasnoff
items.summary:
- Apple and Google have restored TikTok to their app stores in the US, allowing downloads for both iOS and Android.
- The ban on TikTok remains, but enforcement is paused for 75 days per President Trump's order.
- Users without the app can download it directly from TikTok's website on Android, or access it via a web browser on iOS.
- iOS users must use alternative methods, like VPNs, to bypass regional restrictions and access TikTok.
- On Android, users can also choose between TikTok Lite and the full app depending on their device's capability.

items.title: Google Maps in the US will change to Gulf of America and Mount McKinley
items.author: Todd Haselton
items.summary:
- Google plans to update Google Maps to reflect President Trump's executive order changing Gulf of Mexico to Gulf of America and Denali to Mount McKinley.
- The changes will appear once the Geographic Names Information System is updated.
- Denali was previously known as Mount McKinley until 2015.
- The U.S. Department of the Interior will implement the name changes immediately for federal use.

items.title: Trump says he’ll put tariffs on imported chips ‘in the near future’
items.author: Richard Lawler
items.summary:
- Donald Trump announced plans to impose tariffs on foreign computer chips, semiconductors, and pharmaceuticals.
- He expressed skepticism regarding the effectiveness of the $52 billion in subsidies from the CHIPS Act under his potential administration.
- Trump suggested that instead of subsidies, manufacturers will be incentivized by avoiding taxes to bring production back to the US.
- Critics point out past tariffs increased consumer prices significantly on various electronics.
- During a speech at the House GOP Issues Conference, Trump predicted more manufacturing plants could be built in the US shortly, though specifics remain unclear.
- Trump indirectly referenced DeepSeek's AI advancements as a positive development in the tech sector.

items.title: FBI’s warrantless ‘backdoor’ searches ruled unconstitutional
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
• A federal court ruled that the FBI's searches of US citizens' communications under Section 702 of FISA are unconstitutional, violating the Fourth Amendment.
• The ruling was made by US District Court Judge LaShann DeArcy Hall, coming after years of litigation. 
• The case involved Agron Hasbajrami, whose emails were obtained without a warrant. 
• In 2023, the FBI conducted over 57,000 searches of US person data, a 52% decrease from 2022.
• The ruling declares warrantless searches unreasonable and calls for a legislative warrant requirement to protect citizens’ rights.

items.title: Sony reduces OLED burn-in fears with a three-year warranty on InZone monitors
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Sony extends the warranty on InZone M10S gaming monitors to three years, including coverage for OLED burn-in.
- The M10S was launched in September 2024 with an initial one-year warranty.
- This move aligns with a trend among manufacturers to offer burn-in coverage; Alienware and LG are notable examples.
- Consumers are advised to check warranty details for burn-in coverage on other models, as policies vary by manufacturer and model.

items.title: Now Apple tells us how to update AirPods
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Apple released a detailed guide on updating AirPods, AirPods Pro, and AirPods Max firmware.
- Updates now require users to wait for the process to occur automatically.
- New specific suggestions include charging with a USB cable and waiting 30 minutes for the update.
- Step-by-step instructions provided for connecting AirPods and checking firmware versions.
- If the firmware is outdated, users are advised to reset the AirPods and repeat the update process.

items.title: DeepSeek: all the news about the startup that’s shaking up AI stocks
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- DeepSeek is challenging AI industry giants like OpenAI and Meta with cost-efficient large-language models.
- Their flagship R1 reasoning model claims comparable performance to OpenAI’s o1 equivalent.
- The Janus Pro multimodal AI model reportedly outperforms leading models such as Stable Diffusion and DALL-E 3.
- DeepSeek’s AI assistant rapidly rose to the top of the App Store, causing Nvidia’s shares to dip by 17% by January 27, 2025.
- The startup launched in 2023, creating open-source models with less funding and hardware than its competitors.
- The app is currently limiting user sign-ups due to a surge in demand and “malicious attacks.”

items.title: The Pebble smartwatch is making a comeback
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- Eric Migicovsky, founder of Pebble, seeks to revive the smartwatch.
- Google has agreed to open-source the Pebble OS, with the firmware now available on [GitHub](https://opensource.googleblog.com/2025/01/see-code-that-powered-pebble-smartwatches.html).
- A new company is being established to produce wearable devices that emulate the original Pebble experience, with a waitlist available at [RePebble](https://repebble.com/).
- The revival will focus on the unique characteristics of Pebble, such as simplicity, long battery life, and a quirky appeal.
- The new project is intended to foster an open-source community around Pebble OS, encouraging innovation in wearable technology.

items.title: iOS 18.3 is out with tweaks to AI notification summaries
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- iOS 18.3 introduces changes to AI notification summaries by disabling them for news and entertainment apps temporarily.
- This change follows feedback from the BBC regarding incorrect summaries.
- Apple will notify users when the feature is available again.
- Devices supporting Apple Intelligence will have it switched on by default with this update.
- Additional features include using Visual Intelligence for Calendar events and identifying plants and animals.
- Notification summaries will now appear in italicized text and new settings will allow management from the lock screen.
- Users can download the update via Settings > General > Software Update.

items.title: Meta AI will use its ‘memory’ to provide better recommendations
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Meta is launching a memory feature for its AI chatbot to remember user details like dietary preferences and interests.
- The feature will be available across Facebook, Messenger, and WhatsApp in the US and Canada on both iOS and Android.
- The AI will adjust its responses based on user preferences and past conversations, enhancing personalization.
- Users can manage memories in one-on-one chats, with the ability to delete memories anytime.
- Similar memory functionalities exist in chatbots like ChatGPT and Google Gemini.

items.title: Apple’s Sports app now tells you where you can watch nationally broadcast games
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Apple updated its iOS Sports app, adding features for easier navigation and more soccer tournaments.
- Users can now find broadcast information for nationally televised games in the US, such as channels like NHL Network and TNT.
- The update enhances soccer coverage, adding the UK's FA Cup, EFL Championship, and League Cup tournaments.
- Launched in February 2024, the app allows tracking of scores, stats, and betting odds for major sports leagues.
- Previous updates included live scores for NFL and college football, and summaries of key plays and league standings.

items.title: You can grab a refurbished 2021 Kindle Paperwhite starting at $90
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Woot is selling a refurbished 2021 Kindle Paperwhite for $89.99 with a 90-day warranty.
- New customers can use code FIRETENOFF to get an additional $10 off until February 1st, lowering the price to $79.99.
- The device features a 6.8-inch screen, IPX8 waterproof rating, and months-long battery life.

items.title: PBS channels are streaming free inside Amazon’s Prime Video app
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- PBS programming is now available to stream through Amazon Prime Video, along with dedicated FAST channels.
- Users can access live streams from over 150 local PBS affiliate stations and the PBS KIDS Channel without needing a Prime subscription.
- The partnership aims to extend PBS's reach and provide accessible content across various platforms.

items.title: DeepSeek’s top-ranked AI app is restricting sign-ups due to ‘malicious attacks’
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- DeepSeek's AI Assistant restricts new user sign-ups following large-scale malicious attacks.
- Existing users can log in normally; registration is busy rather than completely restricted.
- DeepSeek previously experienced outages affecting user access, but that incident is now resolved.

items.title: New Spotify and UMG deal could create pricier ‘superfan’ subscription
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Spotify and Universal Music Group signed a new multi-year agreement.
- The deal may introduce a tiered subscription for ‘superfans’ with extra perks.
- CEO Sir Lucian Grainge described the agreement as fitting the ‘Streaming 2.0’ vision.
- Proposed features include early access to music, exclusive deluxe editions, hi-res audio, and artist Q&As.
- The deal may increase royalty rates for songwriters following past criticisms of Spotify's rates.
- This is Spotify’s first direct deal with a music publisher since the Music Modernization Act in 2018.

items.title: Genesis turned the GV60 into a snowmobile because it can
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Genesis has revealed a concept called the GV60 MIV (Mountain Intervention Vehicle) designed for rescue operations in snowy conditions.
- The GV60 MIV replaces its wheels with four snow tracks and includes features like bolstered sport seats, medical supplies, and a communications system.
- It also has carbon fiber wheel arc extensions, a roof rack for emergency supplies, and a drone kit in the trunk.
- The vehicle uses a Garmin GPS for navigation and offers vehicle-to-load capabilities to power rescue equipment.
- The GV60 can produce up to 429 horsepower and has an estimated range of 294 miles on a charge.
- The MIV was showcased at the World Economic Forum in Davos, where Genesis has displayed various models since 2023.

items.title: You can get an Apple Watch Series 10 for its lowest price yet
items.author: Quentyn Kennemer
items.summary:
- The Apple Watch Series 10 features a redesigned casing, larger display, and faster charging options.
- 42mm version is on sale for $329 ($70 off), while the 46mm version is priced at $359 ($70 off).
- The displays are 40% brighter and provide 30% more screen area than previous models.
- It includes advanced health features like optical and ECG heart rate monitors and a temperature sensor.
- Battery life is comparable to its predecessors, lasting less than a day, but charges to 80% in 30 minutes.

items.title: Slack’s Monday morning notification mess
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Some Slack users are experiencing issues with missing notifications or difficulty finding messages this morning.
- Slack confirmed the problem, logging an incident report at 7:52 AM ET, and is investigating the issue affecting thread notifications.
- As of 10:10 AM ET, Slack stated that while other notifications should work, threads may not be loading correctly, and some users are facing issues adding members to group chats.

items.title: How Ciena keeps the internet online, with CEO Gary Smith
items.author: Nilay Patel
items.summary:
- Ciena provides essential hardware and software for fiber optic infrastructure worldwide, including undersea cables and local networks.
- CEO Gary Smith discusses Ciena's history, technology, and its role in enabling high-speed internet connectivity since the 1990s.
- Wavelength Division Multiplexing (WDM) is a key technology allowing more data transmission through single fiber cables, crucial for increasing internet demands from streaming and AI applications.
- The customer base has shifted from traditional telecom providers to large cloud companies like Meta, Google, and Microsoft.
- Ciena's technology allows industries to adapt to high data demands and continue to evolve alongside new digital applications and infrastructures.

items.title: China’s DeepSeek AI is hitting Nvidia where it hurts
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- DeepSeek's chatbot has become the most downloaded free app on Apple's App Store, surpassing ChatGPT.
- The DeepSeek AI assistant uses open-source models, reported to be cheaper and more efficient than leading models like OpenAI’s.
- The app's downloads surged after the release of the R1 reasoning model on January 20, which competes with OpenAI's benchmarks.
- DeepSeek's V3 model was developed for less than $6 million using only 2,000 Nvidia chips, compared to over 16,000 for other models.
- Nvidia shares fell over 12% as investors reevaluate the profitability of existing AI investments amidst DeepSeek's rise.

items.title: iPhone SE 4 appears in new photos and video, notch and all
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- New photos and video of the iPhone SE 4 reveal either a real device or a dummy unit.
- The model retains the older notch design instead of adopting the Dynamic Island.
- Includes a single rear camera and the first to feature a USB-C port, required for EU sales.
- Selfie camera's position indicates it follows the iPhone 14's notch setup.
- Rumored to switch to an OLED display and support Apple Intelligence features.
- Expected launch around March or April 2025, following the SE 3 launch in March 2022.

items.title: Retro Remake opens preorders for its PS One FPGA clone
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Retro Remake’s Taki Udon announced that preorders for the SuperStation One have opened.
- The Founders Edition at $149.99 sold out, but standard editions are available for $179.99.
- The SuperStation One is a custom FPGA machine that plays games from various consoles, not just PS1, and has compatibility with original PlayStation peripherals.
- It features a 64GB Micro SD card, multiple ports (USB-A, HDMI, etc.), and is available in black, gray, and translucent blue.
- An expansion slot is included for the upcoming SuperDock accessory, which adds additional storage and ports.

items.title: Netflix won the streaming wars, and we’re all about to pay for it
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- Netflix has increased its standard monthly price from $7.99 to $17.99 over 13 years, with a recent $2.50 hike announced during a quarterly earnings report.
- The platform has become an essential part of mainstream culture, with hit originals and cultural events boosting its standing.
- Netflix's pricing strategy capitalizes on their dominant market position, leading to increased prices while maintaining subscriber engagement. co-CEO Greg Peters indicated they currently earn only 6% of potential revenue in their markets.
- Netflix is promoting its ad-supported plan, as it generates more revenue from this model than purely subscription fees, with about 55% of new subscribers opting for ads.
- The company is exploring live sports and video game content, expanding its dominance in the entertainment sector while competitors struggle with lower subscriber numbers and other issues.

items.title: The 2025 Android upgrade cycle has begun
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- The Samsung Galaxy S25 lineup is highlighted as Samsung's most interesting phones this year.
- The S25 Edge is appreciated for its features, though the entire lineup is considered somewhat boring compared to past years.
- New technologies discussed include the Nvidia GeForce RTX 5090, known for its high price and gaming performance.
- The Android 16 public beta introduces some features including live notifications and forced app resizing for foldable phones.
- Other notable mentions are new projects and apps in the Android ecosystem that enhance user experience and foster creativity.

items.title: Live AI on Meta’s smart glasses is a solution looking for a problem
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- Meta’s new Ray-Ban smart glasses feature Live AI, which can respond to queries about the user's environment.
- The feature lacks practical usefulness and often provides obvious or irrelevant answers.
- Users may struggle to remember to use Live AI over traditional search methods, leading to frustration.
- Live AI’s limitations include difficulties in recognizing when users are talking to it versus others, and a battery that lasts only 30 minutes.

items.title: What Handheld PCs Should Do to Fight the Nintendo Switch 2
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- The author switched from the Nintendo Switch to the Steam Deck due to better game performance and portability.
- Nintendo Switch 2 is set to be released later this year, likely to attract both families and gaming enthusiasts with its extensive game library and improved technology.
- Key improvements for handheld PCs suggested include better ergonomics, switch from Windows to SteamOS, and a standard 1080p-or-lower HDR OLED screen.
- Handheld gaming devices need better battery efficiency and chip design to compete against the Switch 2.
- Price adjustments in the handheld gaming market are necessary to compete against the Switch.

items.title: Oracle and Microsoft are reportedly in talks to take over TikTok
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Oracle and Microsoft are negotiating to take over TikTok’s global operations.
- The deal would allow ByteDance to keep a minority stake, with Oracle overseeing data and algorithm management.
- This agreement aims to reduce Chinese ownership of TikTok.
- Microsoft’s role in the talks remains unclear; it previously participated in a 2020 bid along with Walmart, which is not involved this time.
- News follows a recent executive order from President Trump providing TikTok a 75-day reprieve from enforcement actions regarding its operations in the U.S.

items.title: Fubo’s cheapest streaming plan is now $85 per month
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Fubo raised its English-language streaming plan prices by $5 due to rising programming costs.
- Essential and Pro plans now start at $85 a month; Elite plan is now $95 monthly.
- Fubo's Essential plan debuted at $80 in December but doesn’t include regional sports networks fee.

items.title: All the news about Nvidia’s RTX 50-series GPUs
items.author: Antonio G. Di Benedetto
items.summary:
- Nvidia’s RTX 50-series GPUs set to launch on January 30th, including RTX 5090 and RTX 5080.
- RTX 5070 Ti and RTX 5070 to follow in February.
- RTX 5090 priced at $1,999, featuring DLSS 4 enhancements for gaming performance.
- Comparisons between RTX 5090 and RTX 4090 reveal impressive but not generational leaps in power.
- Concerns may arise regarding limited stock availability for the RTX 5090 at launch.
- Nvidia announces enhancements in frame generation technology with DLSS 4 for improved gaming experiences.

items.title: The best indie games we’re playing right now
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- Indie games are gaining recognition alongside blockbuster titles for their creativity and unique gameplay.
- The article highlights several lesser-known indie games worth playing, including:[Lok Digital](https://lok-digital.com/) - a surreal puzzle game using made-up words.
- [Antonblast](https://www.theverge.com/2025/1/18/24344598/antonblast-review) - a chaotic platformer reminiscent of classic 16-bit games launched in 2024.
- [Skate City: New York](https://www.theverge.com/24339211/skate-city-new-york-review-apple-arcade) - a sequel to the original game, focusing on flow state gameplay and musical integration.

items.title: Marvel Snap is coming back to app stores soon, says developer
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Mobile card game **Marvel Snap** is returning to app stores, beginning with Google Play.
- Developer **Second Dinner** announced the restoration process began at 6PM PT / 3PM ET yesterday and expects returns in both Google and Apple app stores as early as next week.
- The game was previously affected by a TikTok outage due to its original publisher, Nuverse, which is linked to TikTok's parent company, ByteDance.
- As of now, Marvel Snap is still managed by Nuverse.
- Compensation packages for affected players include in-game credits and tokens, particularly for those with US activity prior to the outage.

items.title: Casio’s retro-looking step tracker is on sale for less than 40 bucks today
items.author: Brandon Widder
items.summary:
- The Casio WS-B1000 step tracker is on sale for $39.10, a $17 discount.
- Features include step tracking via an onboard accelerometer, Bluetooth connectivity, and a 2-year battery life.
- Basic functionalities include a stopwatch, timer, and alarm, catering to users seeking a simple tracker without notifications.

items.title: The Best Ebook Reader to Buy Right Now
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- An ebook reader provides a more book-like reading experience with fewer distractions and less eye strain.
- Key features to consider: comfort (display quality, size, weight), build quality (waterproofing, intuitive buttons), supported content types (access to various digital titles), and affordability.
- The Kindle Paperwhite (2024) offers a 7-inch display, faster performance, longer battery life, and waterproofing for $160. 
- The Kobo Libra Colour is recommended as the best non-Amazon reader, featuring physical buttons, a color display, and compatibility with more file formats, but costs more at $219.99.
- The Amazon Kindle (2024) is the best budget option at $110, retaining a 6-inch, 300ppi display and USB-C support.

items.title: Lok Digital is a surreal puzzle game full of made-up words
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- **Lok Digital** is a unique puzzle game where players create made-up words to fill a puzzle board.
- The game features a black-and-white fantasy realm where players aid worm-like creatures by turning squares black using fictional words.
- Gameplay includes developing strategies with various made-up words that have special powers to clear the board.
- **Lok** provides an engaging blend of challenge and ease, including hints and a reference list for words encountered.
- Available on iOS, Android, and PC, the game emphasizes a chill atmosphere with its lo-fi soundtrack.

items.title: Razer Laptop Cooling Pad review: are you a fan?
items.author: Jonathan Hilburg
items.summary:
- Razer's $150 Laptop Cooling Pad claims to lower CPU and GPU temperatures by up to 18% and works with any laptop size.
- It features a 'Hyperboost' mode for compatible Razer models, allowing increased performance by reallocating power to the CPU and GPU.
- Users experienced improved 1080p gaming performance with notable frame rate increases in titles like Cyberpunk 2077 and Shadow of the Tomb Raider.
- The cooling pad produces noise levels around 62 decibels, comparable to a vacuum cleaner.
- Razer's cooling pad is large and requires external power, taking up more desk space than just a laptop.
- Despite its effectiveness on Razer laptops, performance improvements on competing laptops were not significant when tested.

items.title: The AI spending frenzy is just getting started
items.author: Alex Heath
items.summary:
- Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella confirms an $80 billion investment in AI infrastructure without backing OpenAI's Stargate project.
- Nadella's comments indicate a divergence between Microsoft and OpenAI, with Microsoft willing to work with other partners for compute.
- Meta's CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced a massive data center in Louisiana, emphasizing competition within the AI space.
- Major players like OpenAI, Masayoshi Son, and Larry Ellison are expected to secure funding for AI initiatives despite reduced dependence on Microsoft.

items.title: Apple Makes Changes to AI Team and Plans Siri Upgrades
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Kim Vorrath, a 36-year Apple veteran, is appointed as a top deputy in the AI and machine learning division to enhance Siri and AI development.
- Apple has struggled to gain traction with its AI initiatives compared to competitors like OpenAI and Google, despite announcements made at WWDC.
- Major Siri upgrades to enable screen context understanding may not be available until iOS 18.4, and AI-powered news summaries will be paused due to inaccuracies.

items.title: Audi’s lifted Q6 E-tron Off-Road concept is ready for winter driving
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Audi unveils a dual-motor electric off-road vehicle concept based on the Q6 E-tron.
- The prototype features a 6.3-inch lift and 9.8-inch width for enhanced off-road capability.
- The vehicle has four bespoke portal axles, increasing torque by 50%, with a total output of 380kW and up to 9,883 lb ft of torque.
- Designed to climb hills up to 45 degrees, its top speed is capped at 108 mph.
- The Q6 E-tron Offroad concept will be showcased at the FAT International Ice Race in Austria on February 1st.

items.title: Elon Musk email to X staff: ‘we’re barely breaking even’
items.author: Richard Lawler
items.summary:
- Elon Musk describes X's revenue situation as dire, with stagnant user growth and unimpressive revenue.
- Reports indicate banks are preparing to sell off $13 billion in debt related to Musk's acquisition of Twitter (now X).
- Musk stated the company could become cash-flow positive within months, yet faces significant annual interest payments exceeding $1 billion.

items.title: TikTok still isn’t in the App Store
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- TikTok is still unavailable on Apple and Google’s app stores a week after its removal.
- The app was pulled following the US’ ban-or-divest law, leaving the service inaccessible in the US.
- Apple and Google risk billions in fines for re-listing the app; the situation remains unclear despite an executive order from President Trump.
